backend/main.mo: Main Motoko actor implementing calorie tracking with user profiles, activity logging, and daily calorie goals, using access control authorization and migration support.
backend/migration.mo: Migration module that transforms old actor state to new actor state by initializing access control and adding userProfiles and dailyCalorieGoals maps while preserving existing userActivities.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report documenting two implemented features: a goal-setting form component with validation and a dashboard summary displaying daily calorie burn goals.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON summary of frontend files describing React components for authentication, activity tracking, goal setting, and UI styling with OKLCH color system.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom OKLCH color variables for light and dark modes, defining design tokens for backgrounds, borders, and semantic colors.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point for the Calorie Burn Tracker application that loads the React app via main.tsx module script.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component managing authentication state and rendering either a login prompt or the full calorie tracking dashboard with goal setting, activity forms, and activity lists.
frontend/src/components/ActivityForm.tsx: Form component for logging calorie burn activities with validation for activity name, calories, and duration, using React Query mutation and toast notifications.
frontend/src/components/ActivityList.tsx: Scrollable list component displaying sorted activities with timestamps, calories, and duration, featuring loading skeletons and empty state handling.
Displays a summary card showing total calories burned, total duration, activity count, and progress toward a daily calorie goal with loading skeletons and progress bar visualization.
frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx: Renders a footer component with copyright information and a link to caffeine.ai with UTM tracking parameters.
Provides a form to set and update the user's daily calorie burn goal, displaying the current goal and handling submission with validation and toast notifications.
frontend/src/components/Header.tsx: Displays the application header with branding (CalorieBurn logo and title) and authentication controls (login/logout button based on Internet Identity authentication state).
frontend/src/components/LoginPrompt.tsx: Shows a login prompt card with feature highlights (secure authentication, privacy, progress tracking) and a sign-in button for unauthenticated users.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Custom hook that creates and manages the backend actor instance based on Internet Identity authentication state, initializing access control and invalidating queries when identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides Internet Identity authentication context and hooks, managing AuthClient creation, login/logout flows, identity persistence, and authentication status throughout the application.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks for fetching activities, adding activities, getting daily calorie goals, and setting daily calorie goals with automatic cache invalidation.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines Tailwind CSS configuration with custom CSS variables for theming (light and dark modes) including colors for backgrounds, borders, primary/accent colors, and sidebar components.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that renders the React app with QueryClient and InternetIdentityProvider wrappers.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utility functions for extracting, persisting, and clearing URL parameters from both query strings and hash-based routing, with sessionStorage integration.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom color scheme using OKLCH, extended theme properties, animations, and plugins for typography, container queries, and animations.
project_state.json: Project state tracking file documenting a calorie burn tracking app with existing features (activity logging, goal setting, authentication) and pending feature requests.
